text-collection.text: Congratulations! You’ve successfully completed the quiz.
Oops. You didn't get enough correct matches to pass. Why don’t you try again?
To navigate this course you can:
See How Tablets with Intel Inside® Compare
See how tablets powered by Intel stack up to the competition.
Use this comparison to see how tablets with Intel® Inside compare to other tablets powered by ARM* processors.
With so many tablets on the market today, what makes the difference?
Yes, but first and foremost, your customers need great performance. And when it comes to performance, it all comes down to the processor.
Tablets with Intel Inside® deliver the level of performance that keeps up with everything customers need to do.
ALL CORES ARE NOT CREATED EQUAL
Some customers may ask you about core count—many processors provide four cores while others provide two.
TELL YOUR CUSTOMERS THIS IMPORTANT FACT:
MORE CORES DO NOT EQUAL BETTER PERFORMANCE!
In fact, processor performance relies on a number of factors, not just core counts. For example:
Intel processor cores are optimized to the point that they can outperform competitors that have to rely on more cores.
Overall performance can’t be measured by number of cores—other factors, such as how the cores work together, have to be considered as well.
If your customers—or even you—need more proof that tablets powered by Intel are the best choice, look no further.
We’ve tested tablets powered by Intel® processors and ARM* processors that are similarly priced with similar screen sizes.
ENJOY SURFING THE WEB AT LIGHTNING FAST SPEED
THE TABLET WITH INTEL INSIDE® IS BETWEEN…
ADD FILTERS AND CREATE COLLAGES—FASTER THAN EVER
THE TABLET WITH INTEL INSIDE® IS BETWEEN…
THE TABLET WITH INTEL INSIDE® PROVIDES BETWEEN…

Software and workloads used in performance tests may have been optimized for performance only on Intel microprocessors. Performance tests, such as SYSmark* and MobileMark*, are measured using specific computer systems, components, software, operations and functions. Any change to any of those factors may cause the results to vary. You should consult other information and performance tests to assist you in fully evaluating your contemplated purchases, including the performance of that product when combined with other products. For more information go to http://www.intel.com/performance

When it comes to tablet performance, help your customers focus on:
More cores always means better performance.
In this infographic, tablets running Intel® processors were compared to similar tablets powered by:
Which of the following is a factor to consider when it comes to measuring overall performance?
The screen size of the tablet
How many times a day the customer will use the tablet
How well the processor cores work together
The Dell Venue 7* tablet powered by Intel was between 65% and 72% faster[1] than similarly priced tablets for:
